BUSINESS_PARTNER.title: BUSINESS PARTNER
BUSINESS_PARTNER.description:
ORGANIZATION (firm, branch office), individual or a group of individuals or organizations in which your company has a business interest.
A BUSINESS PARTNER is a generalization for the roles CUSTOMER, VENDOR, and EMPLOYEE, holding all the attributes and relationships / associations which are common for all of these.

id.title: identifier
id.description: The main identifier of this Business Partner in a specific IT system.

activeInHealthcare.title: activeInHealthcare
activeInHealthcare.description:
Indicates if the Business Partner is active in the healthcare sector:
* if type = ORGANISZATION it is a Health Care Organization (HCO)
* if type = INDIVIDUAL it is a Health Care Professional (HCP)

centralBlock.title: centralBlockForBusinessPartner
centralBlock.description: The Central Block for Business Partner indicates that the BP is blocked for usage (no payments, no purchase orders) for all company codes and purchasing organizations.

createdDate.title: createdDate
createdDate.description: Date of creation of a BUSINESS PARTNER in a specific IT System.

updateTimestamp.title: updateTimestamp
updateTimestamp.description: The date and time of the last modification of this Business Partner in a specific IT system.

contractManagementRelevance.title: contractManagementRelevance
contractManagementRelevance.description: Flag is set when a Business Partner only is created for the purposes of fulfilling CorA the BI Contract Management System. The Business Partner record must be created in the master data management tool of BI as the leading system, data is subsequently transferred to CorA.

dunsNumber.title: dunsNumber
dunsNumber.description: The DUNS number issued by Duns and Bradstreet for a Business Partner.

riskAssesmentStatus.title: riskAssesmentStatus
riskAssesmentStatus.description: The Risk Assesment Status field documents the process status of a SUPPLIER record in the Risk Assesment process during creation of the SUPPLIER record.

riskAssesmentResponsibleId.title: riskAssesmentResponsible.id
riskAssesmentResponsibleId.description: The Risk Assessment Responsible person assigned to this Business Partner.

riskAssesmentResponsibleEmail.title: riskAssesmentResponsible.email
riskAssesmentResponsibleEmail.description:
The Risk Assessment Responsible person assigned to this Business Partner.

Email Address

screeningStatus.title: screeningStatus
screeningStatus.description:
The Screening Status documents the  status of a SUPPLIER record regarding screening proess to check if a potential new external Business Partner (vendor & customer) is listed on an official sanctions- and/or blacklist.
Business Partners with Screening Status blocked are not distributed to any other system.

type.title: businessPartnerType
type.description: The BUSINESS PARTNER TYPE describes if the Business Partner is a natural person (individual, e.g. HCP, Contact, Vet) an organization (corporation, e.g. Hospital) or an animal.

targetTemplate.title: targetTemplate
targetTemplate.description:
A choice of country specific templates are available for customer and supplier extentions of existing records to additional company codes, sales areas, purchasing organisations. These templates are designed to reflect different customer and supplier types containing relevant prepopulated data. Please chose the appropriate template for your change process.
Only requestor of a Change Request of type "Know Your Business Partner", Create or Change are allowed to maintain a template value, which is later used as Extension Template.

ultimateParentDunsNumber.title: ultimateParent.dunsGlobalUltimateParent
ultimateParentDunsNumber.description: DUNS Global Ultimate Parent (GUP) is the DUNS number of the root parent node in company corporate structure. It is a nine digit number.

ultimateParentDunsName.title: ultimateParent.dunsGlobalUltimateParentName
ultimateParentDunsName.description: DUNS Global Ultimate Parent (GUP) is the DUNS name of the root parent node in company corporate structure.

addresses.title: addressUsage
addresses.description: ADDRESS USAGE says that a certain BUSINESS PARTNER is using a certain ADDRESS (which is (usually) independent of a BUSINESS PARTNER). Via the relationship to ADDRESS TYPE it also tells the purpose which the address is used for, e.g. Sold-To, Bill-To, Ship-To, Private, Office, ... (see Examples tab of ADDRESS TYPE).

items.title: ADDRESS USAGE
items.description: Address usage says that a certain business partner is using a certain address (which is (usually) independent of a business partner). Via the relationship to ADDRESS TYPE it also tells the purpose which the address is used for, e.g. Sold-To, Bill-To, Ship-To, Private, Office, ... (see Examples tab of ADDRESS TYPE).

doNotUseReason.title: doNotUseReason
doNotUseReason.description: This field is to maintain the reason why a specific address cannot or should not be used.

isStandardAddress.title: primaryFlag
isStandardAddress.description:
The Primary Flag is an indicator for the Standard Address Usage (True/False)
Used in case multiple addresses are defined for a Business Partner .
The Primary Flag may be set only for one ADDRESS per BUSINESS PARTNER and a single ADDRESS USAGE.

locationEmails.title: location.emails
locationEmails.description: eMail is a communication type used in customer communication. eMail includes the eMail address.

locationFaxes.title: location.faxs
locationFaxes.description: Fax is a communication type used in customer communication. Fax includes the full fax number, including area code, etc.

locationTelephones.title: location.telephones
locationTelephones.description: Telephone is a communication type used in customer communication. Telephone includes the full telephone number, including area code, etc.

locationWebs.title: location.webs
locationWebs.description: COMMUNICATION CHANNEL WEB reflects the WEB-Sites that a customer has and where we can find information about him. This can be his private WEB-Site, the official Company Homepage of a HCO or even a dedicated page of a HCO where is information about a HCP is available (e.g. as a kind of staff member profile).

items.title: WEB
items.description: COMMUNICATION CHANNEL WEB reflects the WEB-Sites that a customer has and where we can find information about him. This can be his private WEB-Site, the official Company Homepage of a HCO or even a dedicated page of a HCO where is information about a HCP is available (e.g. as a kind of staff member profile).

isStandardUrl.title: isStandardUrl
isStandardUrl.description: This field indicates that this Web ULR Is the Standard URL for a defined use.

doNotUseFlag.title: doNotUseFlag
doNotUseFlag.description: The Do not Use Flag indicates that a particular Communication Number is Not Used.

locationFaxs.title: location.faxs
locationFaxs.description: Fax is a communication type used in customer communication. Fax includes the full fax number, including area code, etc.

allOf.title: ADDRESS
allOf.description:
An ADDRESS is the particulars of the place where a business partner is situated for example the purposes of postal delivery.
ADDRESS contains the non-localized attributes of this place.
LOCALIZED ADDRESS contains the localized attributes of this place.

addressClassification.title: addressClassification
addressClassification.description: Address Classification is used to indicate which kind of Address is delivered. There existi (country) specific rules which are not considered for classification. Then the value UNKNOWN is returned.

careOfName.title: careOfName
careOfName.description:
c/o name

Part of the address (c/o = care of) if the recipient is different from the occupant and the names are not similar (e.g. subtenants).

Source: SAP field help

city.title: city
city.description: Name of the City for the postal ADDRESS

cityDistrict.title: cityDistrict
cityDistrict.description: Customer Neighborhood description within a City.

companyPostalCode.title: companyPostalCode
companyPostalCode.description: The Company Postal Code is used for countries where major companies are assigned their own postal code by the national post office.

houseNumberSupplement.title: houseNumberSupplement
houseNumberSupplement.description:
House Number Supplement may be used in case a more specific description than the Address with Street Name and House Number is required.
E.g. track 7, ramp 5

line1.title: addressLine1
line1.description: May be used as alternative to Street Name and House Number or in addition to these attributes.

line2.title: addressLine2
line2.description: May be used as alternative to Street Name and House Number or in addition to these attributes.

line3.title: addressLine3
line3.description: May be used as alternative to Street Name and House Number or in addition to these attributes.

line4.title: addressLine4
line4.description: May be used as alternative to Street Name and House Number or in addition to these attributes.

postboxCity.title: postboxCity
postboxCity.description:
The PO Box city can be maintained here if it is different from the address city.
If the address contains only a PO Box address, then the "normal" city field is maintained.
Source: SAP field help

postboxPostalCode.title: postboxPostalCode
postboxPostalCode.description:
The Postal code that is required for a unique assignment of the PO box
This field is used for countries where a different postal code applies to mail that is sent to the PO box rather than to the street address of a particular business partner.

postboxWithoutNumber.title: postboxWithoutNumber
postboxWithoutNumber.description: This field is set to true if the PO Box is without a number.

streetNameExtension.title: streetNameExtension
streetNameExtension.description: Additional address text line for Street Name

streetNameExtension2.title: streetNameExtension2
streetNameExtension2.description: 2nd Additional address text line for Street Name

streetNameExtension3.title: streetNameExtension3
streetNameExtension3.description: 3rd Additional address text line for Street Name

streetNameExtension4.title: streetNameExtension4
streetNameExtension4.description: 4th Additional address text line for Street Name

taxJurisdictionCode.title: taxJurisdictionCode
taxJurisdictionCode.description: The (Tax) Jurisdiction Code is a key which (together with the tax code) determines the tax amount and the way in which payment of the total tax amount is divided between different tax authorities. Jurisdiction codes are used in the USA and Brazil.

countryIso2Code.title: country.alpha-2Code
countryIso2Code.description: The Alpha-2 code according to ISO 3166-1

countryRefId.title: country.referenceDataId
countryRefId.description: The Reference Data ID is the (technical) Identifier of all REFERNCE DATA maintained in the Reference Data Management System.

countryName.title: country.name
countryName.description:
The term is the human readable unique name typically used in drop down menus of applications. 
In cases when the complete name is too long, then a meaningful abbreviation is created for the term.
English is the leading Language.

countrySubdivisionSapCode.title: countrySubdivision.sapCode
countrySubdivisionSapCode.description: A Country Subdivision is indentified in SAP MDG by the code for the country together with the code for the country subdivision (SAP name: region).

countrySubdivisionIsoCode.title: countrySubdivision.isoCode
countrySubdivisionIsoCode.description:
The Code according to ISO 3166-2.
If a COUNTRY SUBDIVISION is defined for a level not provided by ISO, then this Code remains empty (0). Instead an Alternate National Code has to be provided.

countrySubdivisionAlternateNationalCode.title: countrySubdivision.alternateNationalCode
countrySubdivisionAlternateNationalCode.description:
A COUNTRY may specify it's own Codes to identify COUNTRY SUBDIVISIONs.
E.g. in the US this Alternate National Code is the so called FIPS-Code.

countrySubdivisionRefId.title: countrySubdivision.referenceDataId
countrySubdivisionRefId.description: The Reference Data ID is the (technical) Identifier of all REFERNCE DATA maintained in the Reference Data Management System.

countrySubdivisionName.title: countrySubdivision.name
countrySubdivisionName.description:
The term is the human readable unique name typically used in drop down menus of applications. 
In cases when the complete name is too long, then a meaningful abbreviation is created for the term.
English is the leading Language.

languageIso2Code.title: language.alpha-2Code
languageIso2Code.description: The Alpha-2 Code according to Iso 639.

languageRefId.title: language.referenceDataId
languageRefId.description: The Reference Data ID is the (technical) Identifier of all REFERNCE DATA maintained in the Reference Data Management System.

languageName.title: language.name
languageName.description:
The term is the human readable unique name typically used in drop down menus of applications. 
In cases when the complete name is too long, then a meaningful abbreviation is created for the term.
English is the leading Language.

localizedAddress.title: localizedAddress - use localizedAddresses
localizedAddress.description: The LOCALIZED ADDRESS is an ADDRESS converted into another WRITING SYSTEM as e.g. Arabic, Chinese, Cyrillic, Greek & Thai.

localizedAddresses.title: localizedAddresses
localizedAddresses.description: The LOCALIZED ADDRESS is an ADDRESS converted into another WRITING SYSTEM as e.g. Arabic, Chinese, Cyrillic, Greek & Thai."

writingSystemSapCode.title: writingSystem.sapCode
writingSystemSapCode.description: This SAP Code identifies the international display format in which an address can be stored in the system.

writingSystem.title: writingSystem.term
writingSystem.description: This SAP Code identifies the international display format in which an address can be stored in the system.

countryEnglishShortName.title: address.country.englishShortName
countryEnglishShortName.description: English short name according to ISO 3166-1

locationGeographicalInformationCityCoord.title: location.geographicalInformation.cityCoordinates
locationGeographicalInformationCityCoord.description: Coordinates of the city in which e.g. the headquarter of a BUSINESS PARTNER is located.

identifiers.title: address.identifiers
identifiers.description: DEPRECATED property, bad naming. There is only one address identifier

affiliations.title: affiliationsToBusinessPartner
affiliations.description: Business Partner to Business Partner Affiliation describes the relationship between two Business Partners.

items.title: BUSINESS PARTNER AFFILIATION
items.description: Business Partner to Business Partner Affiliation describes the relationship between two Business Partners.

defaultRelationship.title: defaultRelationship
defaultRelationship.description: If you have a relationship of the same kind multiple times (e.g. more then 1 ship to partners) this flag defines the Default Partner for this dedicated Business Partner Affiliation Type.

positionName.title: positionName
positionName.description: BP Affiliation with an affiliation type like employment or contact person may have the Position Name as additional information.

startDate.title: startDate
startDate.description: The Start Date indicates when the Business Partner Affiliation begins.

endDate.title: endDate
endDate.description: The End Date indicates when the Business Partner Affiliation finishes.

typeCode.title: affiliationType.code
typeCode.description: The Code identifies the type of a relationship but not the direction of that relationship.

typeDescription.title: affiliationType.description
typeDescription.description: The description text for a specific AFFILIATION TYPE including additional information about the direction of the relation.

sourceBusinessPartnerId.title: sourceBusinessPartnerId.identifier
sourceBusinessPartnerId.description: Internal or External (alternative) Identifier of the Business Partner.

targetBusinessPartnerId.title: targetBusinessPartnerId.identifier
targetBusinessPartnerId.description: Internal or External (alternative) Identifier of the Business Partner.

alternateIds.title: businessPartnerIdentifiers
alternateIds.description: A Business Partner can be stored in different SYSTEMS and can have in these SYSTEMS different internal and external identifiers.

items.title: BUSINESS PARTNER IDENTIFIER
items.description: A Business Partner can be stored in different SYSTEMS and can have in these SYSTEMS different internal and external identifiers.

id.title: identifier
id.description: Internal or External (alternative) Identifier of the Business Partner.

idTypeCode.title: identifierType.code
idTypeCode.description: The Code is the unique identifier of the data record for this object.

idTypeName.title: identifierType.term
idTypeName.description: Term is a human readable designator of the data record for this object.

startDate.title: startDate
startDate.description: The Start Date indicates by when the Business Partner Identifier becomes valid.

endDate.title: endDate
endDate.description: The End Date indicates by when the Business Partner Identifier loses its validity.

countryIso2Code.title: country.alpha-2Code
countryIso2Code.description: The Alpha-2 code according to ISO 3166-1

idOwner.title: hinIdOwner
idOwner.description:
This field contains the owner of the identifier.
If the BUSINESS PARTNER IDENTIFIER TYPE is "HIN" (healthcare industry number) then it contains the owning organization of the "HIN ID".

bankAccounts.title: bankAccounts
bankAccounts.description:
BANK ACCOUNT is containing all the information needed to uniquely and correctly identify the bank coordinates of a business partner to be used for payment processes. This can be needed both for creditors (Customers) and for debitors (Vendor, Employee).
BANK ACCOUNT is including the bank account number, a reference to the bank branch managing the bank account, an IBAN code when relevant, information about the bank account currency, etc...
A Business Partner may own multiple Bank Accounts.

items.title: BANK ACCOUNT
items.description:
BANK ACCOUNT is containing all the information needed to uniquely and correctly identify the bank coordinates of a business partner to be used for payment processes. This can be needed both for creditors (Customers) and for debitors (Vendor, Employee).
BANK ACCOUNT is including the bank account number, a reference to the bank branch managing the bank account, an IBAN code when relevant, information about the bank account currency, etc...
A Business Partner may own multiple Bank Accounts.

active.title: active
active.description: Indicates whether a financial instrument is active or inactive. true=Active, false=Inactive.

paymentAlias.title: paymentAlias
paymentAlias.description:
Name used to identify the payment method.
DEPRECATED: Use name instead.

id.title: bankAccountId
id.description: The Bank account ID (called Bank details ID or Partner bank type in MDG) is the SAP internal key that identifies bank details for a given BUSINESS PARTNER.

name.title: bankAccountName
name.description: An additional name can be used to describe a BANK ACCOUNT.

accountHolder.title: accountHolder
accountHolder.description: If the name of the account holder is not the same as the name of the Business Partner then the name is entered in this field.

bankAccountNumber.title: bankAccountNumber
bankAccountNumber.description: This field contains the number under which the account is managed at the bank.

bankControlKey.title: bankControlKey
bankControlKey.description:
The field contains a check key for the combination bank number and bank account number.
The rules for verification are defined by the respective countries.

collectionAuthorization.title: collectionAuthorization
collectionAuthorization.description:
States that the bank has collection authorization from the business partner for the account.
Set this indicator if the bank has collection authorization.
Source: SAP field help

iban.title: iban
iban.description:
The International Bank Account Number (IBAN) is a uniform standardized ID number for representing a bank account that is in accordance with the ECBS (European Committee for Banking Standards). An IBAN has a maximum of 34 alphanumeric characters and is a combination of the following elements:

Country key of the bank (ISO code)
Two-digit check number

Country-specific account number (in Germany this consists of the bank number and account number, in France the bank number, account number and check key).

Source: SAP field help

accountType.title: bankAccountType
accountType.description: A BANK ACCOUNT TYPE describes the purpose of a financial account, e.g., deposit account or savings account.

endDate.title: endDate
endDate.description:
Valid to Date of BANK ACCOUNT.
To deactivate the BANK ACCOUNT set this date to the current date.

creditCards.title: creditCards
creditCards.description: A credit card is a payment card issued to users (cardholders) to enable the cardholder to pay a merchant for goods and services based on the cardholder's promise to the card issuer to pay them for the amounts plus the other agreed charges. The card issuer (usually a bank) creates a revolving account and grants a line of credit to the cardholder, from which the cardholder can borrow money for payment to a merchant or as a cash advance. (Source: Wikipedia)

items.title: CREDIT CARD
items.description: A credit card is a payment card issued to users (cardholders) to enable the cardholder to pay a merchant for goods and services based on the cardholder's promise to the card issuer to pay them for the amounts plus the other agreed charges. The card issuer (usually a bank) creates a revolving account and grants a line of credit to the cardholder, from which the cardholder can borrow money for payment to a merchant or as a cash advance. (Source: Wikipedia)

active.title: active
active.description: Indicates whether a financial instrument is active or inactive. true=Active, false=Inactive.

paymentAlias.title: paymentAlias
paymentAlias.description:
Name used to identify the payment method.
DEPRECATED: Use name instead.

cardCategory.title: cardCategory
cardCategory.description: Card category of the payment card.

id.title: creditCardId
id.description: Unique Identifier of Credit Card as created by ERP system

cardVerificationValue.title: cardVerificationValue
cardVerificationValue.description:
Card Verification Value (CVV) is a 3- or 4-digit number used to verify that the card is physically there. Thus it's meant to make it less easy to abuse stolen or faked credit card infos.
Other names:
Card Validation Code (CVC), Card Verification Number (CVN), Card Security Code (CSC), Card Code Verification (CCV)

creditCardNumberLastFourDigits.title: creditCardNumberLastFourDigits
creditCardNumberLastFourDigits.description:
The last 4 digits of the number imprinted on a credit card. 
Boehringer does not store a complete credit card number of any business partner, but a credit card token instead.

cardNumber.title: cardNumber
cardNumber.description:
The Credit Card Number.
For Credit Cards either Credit Card Number with additional information needs to be maintained or the Credit Card Token shared with the Token Processing Organization.

creditCardToken.title: creditCardToken
creditCardToken.description:
A credit card token is a key / code for an actual credit card number. The translation / mapping of this code to the actual credit card number is known only to the credit card issuing organization or its trusted transaction processing organization. 
Usually Boehringer only holds a credit card token for any credit card, instead of the actual credit card number (for data security reasons).

expirationDate.title: expirationDate
expirationDate.description:
Date on which the payment card becomes invalid.
This means the last month the credit card is valid to be used.

nameOfCardholder.title: nameOfCardholder
nameOfCardholder.description: The (first and last) name of the person or company embossed on the payment card.

reasonForPaymentCardLock.title: reasonForPaymentCardLock
reasonForPaymentCardLock.description:
Indicates whether a payment card is blocked and for what reason.
This block only applies to one particular payment card. If the client has several payment cards, another card can still be used.
[Source: SAP field help]

standardPaymentCard.title: standardPaymentCard
standardPaymentCard.description:
Indicates that this is the standard payment card of a business partner, should there be more than one set of payment card details.
[Source: SAP field help]

validFromDate.title: validFromDate
validFromDate.description: Start of validity of the payment card.

doingBusinessAs.title: doingBusinessAs
doingBusinessAs.description:
A BUSINESS PARTNER may have fictitious business names if the name used for business is a different name than the (registered) BUSINESS PARTNER NAME.
In the U.S., a DOING BUSINESS AS (DBA) NAME lets the public know who the real owner of a business is. The DOING BUSINESS AS (DBA) is also called a fictitious business name or assumed business name. It got its origins as a form of consumer protection, so dishonest business owners couldnâ€™t try to avoid legal trouble by operating under a different name.

roles.title: roles
roles.description: A BUSINESS PARTNER may different BUSINESS PARTNER ROLES assigned.

taxNumbers.title: taxNumbers
taxNumbers.description: A Tax Number usually is an identifying number issued by the particular responsible institution for tax purposes.

searchTerms.title: defaultName.searchTerms
searchTerms.description: SEARCH TERM is a non mandatory, non governed grouping which can be syndicated across systems.

defaultLanguageIso2code.title: defaultLanguage.alpha-2Code
defaultLanguageIso2code.description: The Alpha-2 Code according to Iso 639.

defaultLanguageRefId.title: defaultLanguage.referenceDataId
defaultLanguageRefId.description: The Reference Data ID is the (technical) Identifier of all REFERNCE DATA maintained in the Reference Data Management System.

emails.title: emails
emails.description: eMail is a communication type used in customer communication. eMail includes the eMail address.

items.title: EMAIL
items.description: eMail is a communication type used in customer communication. eMail includes the eMail address.

isStandardEmail.title: isStandardE-Mail
isStandardEmail.description: This field indicates that this Email Is the Standard Email for a defined use.

doNotUseFlag.title: doNotUseFlag
doNotUseFlag.description: The Do not Use Flag indicates that a particular Communication Number is Not Used.

faxes.title: faxes
faxes.description: Fax is a communication type used in customer communication. Fax includes the full fax number, including area code, etc.

items.title: FAX
items.description: Fax is a communication type used in customer communication. Fax includes the full fax number, including area code, etc.

usageTypeName.title: communicationChannelUsageType.term
usageTypeName.description: Term is a human readable designator of the data record for this object.

numberComplete.title: faxNumberComplete
numberComplete.description: The Complete Fax Number. That means dialing code + number + extension.

isStandardFaxNumber.title: isStandardFaxNumber
isStandardFaxNumber.description: This field indicates that this Fax Number is the Standard Phone Number for a defined use.

countryIso2Code.title: faxCountry.alpha-2Code
countryIso2Code.description: The Alpha-2 code according to ISO 3166-1

countryCallingCode.title: faxCountry.countryCallingCode
countryCallingCode.description: Country calling codes or country dial in codes are telephone dialing prefixes for the member countries or regions of the International Telecommunication Union (ITU). They are defined by the ITU-T in standards E.123 and E.164. The prefixes enable international direct dialing (IDD), and are also referred to as international subscriber dialing (ISD) codes.

countryRefId.title: faxCountry.referenceDataId
countryRefId.description: The Reference Data ID is the (technical) Identifier of all REFERNCE DATA maintained in the Reference Data Management System.

doNotUseFlag.title: doNotUseFlag
doNotUseFlag.description: The Do not Use Flag indicates that a particular Communication Number is Not Used.

telephones.title: telephones
telephones.description: Telephone is a communication type used in customer communication. Telephone includes the full telephone number, including area code, etc.

items.title: TELEPHONE
items.description: Telephone is a communication type used in customer communication. Telephone includes the full telephone number, including area code, etc.

usageTypeName.title: communicationChannelUsageType.term
usageTypeName.description: Term is a human readable designator of the data record for this object.

isStandardPhoneNumber.title: isStandardPhoneNumber
isStandardPhoneNumber.description: This field indicates that this Phone Number Is the Standard Phone Number for a defined use.

numberComplete.title: telephoneNumberComplete
numberComplete.description: Telephone Number with Country Prefix, Dialling Code and with Extension

countryIso2Code.title: phoneCountry.alpha-2Code
countryIso2Code.description: The Alpha-2 code according to ISO 3166-1

countryCallingCode.title: phoneCountry.countryCallingCode
countryCallingCode.description: Country calling codes or country dial in codes are telephone dialing prefixes for the member countries or regions of the International Telecommunication Union (ITU). They are defined by the ITU-T in standards E.123 and E.164. The prefixes enable international direct dialing (IDD), and are also referred to as international subscriber dialing (ISD) codes.

countryEnglishShortName.title: phoneCountry.englishShortName
countryEnglishShortName.description: English short name according to ISO 3166-1

countryRefId.title: phoneCountry.referenceDataId
countryRefId.description: The Reference Data ID is the (technical) Identifier of all REFERNCE DATA maintained in the Reference Data Management System.

doNotUseFlag.title: doNotUseFlag
doNotUseFlag.description: The Do not Use Flag indicates that a particular Communication Number is Not Used.

extension.title: extension
extension.description: A Phone Number may have an Extension

isMobilePhoneNumber.title: isMobilePhoneNumber
isMobilePhoneNumber.description: Telephone Number blongs to a Mobile Phone

users.title: users
users.description:
A USER is an account in an INFORMATION SYSTEM which allows ACCESS to that INFORMATION SYSTEM. 
Creating a user in a certain information system automatically includes creating a USER PERMISSION for the basic access to the information system which we assume to be of ACCESS TYPE "Login" - though a real login ("enter username and password") has not to be necessary: Users like "Guest" or "Anonymous" or "<void>" are well possible - especially in web based information systems (e.g. search engines). Therefore, propositions for a better name for "Login" are welcome!.
A user may be assigned to e.g. a single person, a working group, or a batch job (which has to be run within the information system) - or it may be not assigned at all.

ownedCompanies.title: ownedCompanies
ownedCompanies.description: Business Partner to Business Partner Affiliation describes the relationship between two Business Partners.

items.title: Company Ownership
items.description: Business Partner to Business Partner Affiliation describes the relationship between two Business Partners.

ultimateBeneficialOwner.title: ultimateBeneficialOwner
ultimateBeneficialOwner.description:
The ULTIMATE BENEFICIAL OWNER (UBO) refers to the person or entity ultimately benefiting from the business relationship. I.e. it is the person which is the ultimate beneficiary person when an institution initiates a transaction.

The definition of who constitutes a UBO varies between jurisdiction, but generally a UBO is defined as an individual who holds a minimum of 10-25% (dependent on jurisdiction) of capital, voting rights or is the beneficiary of the capital in the underlying entity.

telephoneNumberComplete.title: defaultTelephone.telephoneNumberComplete
telephoneNumberComplete.description: Telephone Number with Country Prefix, Dialling Code and with Extension

telephoneCountryIso3Code.title: defaultTelephone.phoneCountry.alpha-3Code
telephoneCountryIso3Code.description: The Alpha-3 code according to ISO 3166-1

faxNumberComplete.title: defaultFax.faxNumberComplete
faxNumberComplete.description: The Complete Fax Number. That means dialing code + number + extension.

addressCity.title: defaultAddress.address.city
addressCity.description: Name of the City for the postal ADDRESS

addressLine1.title: defaultAddress.address.addressLine1
addressLine1.description: May be used as alternative to Street Name and House Number or in addition to these attributes.

addressLine2.title: defaultAddress.address.addressLine2
addressLine2.description: May be used as altrernative to Street Name and House Number or in addition to these attributes.

addressLine3.title: defaultAddress.address.addressLine3
addressLine3.description: May be used as altrernative to Street Name and House Number or in addition to these attributes.

addressLine4.title: defaultAddress.address.addressLine4
addressLine4.description: May be used as altrernative to Street Name and House Number or in addition to these attributes.

addressCountryIso2Code.title: address.country.alpha-2Code
addressCountryIso2Code.description: The Alpha-2 code according to ISO 3166-1

addressCountryIso3Code.title: address.country.alpha-3Code
addressCountryIso3Code.description: The Alpha-3 code according to ISO 3166-1

addressCountrySapCode.title: address.country.sapCode
addressCountrySapCode.description: The SAP Code is the unique identifier from SAP to identity the data record.

addressCountryRefId.title: country.referenceDataId
addressCountryRefId.description: The Reference Data ID is the (technical) Identifier of all REFERNCE DATA maintained in the Reference Data Management System.

addressCountrySubdivisionIsoCode.title: address.countrySubdivision.isoCode
addressCountrySubdivisionIsoCode.description:
The Code according to ISO 3166-2.
If a COUNTRY SUBDIVISION is defined for a level not provided by ISO, then this Code remains empty (0). Instead an Alternate National Code has to be provided.

addressCountrySubdivisionName.title: address.countrySubdivision.term
addressCountrySubdivisionName.description:
The Term is the human readable unique and complete name.
In cases when the complete name fits into the Term then it is identical to the Short Description.
Else it contains an abbreviated version of the complete name.
English is the leading Language.
The name of a coutry subdivision. This might by a state (e.g. US), an province (e.g. CA), a deparement (e.g. F) and so on.

addressCountrySubdivisionAlternateNation.title: address.countrySubdivision.alternateNationalCode
addressCountrySubdivisionAlternateNation.description:
A COUNTRY may specify it's own Codes to identify COUNTRY SUBDIVISIONs.
E.g. in the US this Alternate National Code is the so called FIPS-Code.

addressCountrySubdivisionRefId.title: countrySubdivision.referenceDataId
addressCountrySubdivisionRefId.description: The Reference Data ID is the (technical) Identifier of all REFERNCE DATA maintained in the Reference Data Management System.

DoingBusinessAsName.title: doingBusinessAsName
DoingBusinessAsName.description:
A BUSINESS PARTNER may have additional business names if the name used for business is a different name than the (registered) BUSINESS PARTNER NAME.
In the U.S., a DOING BUSINESS AS (DBA) NAME lets the public know who the real owner of a business is. The DOING BUSINESS AS (DBA) is also called a fictitious business name or assumed business name. It got its origins as a form of consumer protection, so dishonest business owners couldn’t try to avoid legal trouble by operating under a different name.

name.title: name
name.description: The name with which a BUSINESS PARTNER is doing business as.

priority.title: priority
priority.description: If a BUSINESS PARTNER has more than one DBA name, then the list of names is ordered by a priority.

BusinessPartnerRoleAffiliation.title: businessPartnerRoleAffiliation
BusinessPartnerRoleAffiliation.description: BUSINESS PARTNER TYPE AFFILIATION is the resolution of the many to many relationship between BUSINESS PARTNER and BUSINESS PARTNER TYPE.

code.title: role.code
code.description: The Code to identify the BUSINESS PARTNER ROLE.

typeCode.title: role.typeCode
typeCode.description: The Code to classify the type of the BUSINESS PARTNER ROLE.

validFrom.title: validFrom
validFrom.description: The date on which the role was assigned to a Business Partner.

validTo.title: validTo
validTo.description: The date on which a role was deactivated for a Business Partner.

TaxNumber.title: taxNumber
TaxNumber.description: A Tax Number usually is an identifying number issued by the particular responsible institution for tax purposes.

number.title: taxNumber
number.description:
Specifies the Tax Number at a Responsible Tax Authority.
The taxnumber is the tax number independent from the lenght.

typeCode.title: taxNumberType.code
typeCode.description: The Code of a Tax Number Category contains the Country Key in its string.

typeName.title: taxNumberType.term
typeName.description: Term is a human readable designator of the data record for this object.

typeCountrySapCode.title: taxNumberType.country.sapCode
typeCountrySapCode.description: The SAP Code is the unique identifier from SAP to identity the data record.

SearchTerm.title: searchTerm
SearchTerm.description: SEARCH TERM is a non mandatory, non governed grouping which can be syndicated across systems.

orderNumber.title: searchTermOrderingNumber
orderNumber.description: The Number of the Search Term: 1 for "Search Term 1", 2 for "Search Term 2"

User.title: user
User.description:
A USER is an account in an INFORMATION SYSTEM which allows ACCESS to that INFORMATION SYSTEM. 
Creating a user in a certain information system automatically includes creating a USER PERMISSION for the basic access to the information system which we assume to be of ACCESS TYPE "Login" - though a real login ("enter username and password") has not to be necessary: Users like "Guest" or "Anonymous" or "<void>" are well possible - especially in web based information systems (e.g. search engines). Therefore, propositions for a better name for "Login" are welcome!.
A user may be assigned to e.g. a single person, a working group, or a batch job (which has to be run within the information system) - or it may be not assigned at all.

name.title: name
name.description: Name of User (First Name, (Middle Name), Last name)

isActive.title: isActiveFlag
isActive.description: shows if the user is active. i.e. able to use the information system

validSystemsName.title: informationSystems
validSystemsName.description: An INFORMATION SYSTEM is a software system (or application system) which allows for processing data in certain well-defined ways.

items.title: name
items.description: The name is a user-friendly identifier for the information system. If the information system is run by a 3rd party, the name should point to that 3rd party.

UltimateBeneficialOwner.title: ultimateBeneficialOwner
UltimateBeneficialOwner.description: The ULTIMATE BENEFICIAL OWNER (UBO) refers to the person or entity ultimately benefiting from the business relationship. I.e. it is the person which is the ultimate beneficiary person when an institution initiates a transaction.

name.title: name
name.description: The name of the ULTIMATE BENEFICIAL OWNER is provided by D&B web service.

shareInPercentage.title: shareInPercentage
shareInPercentage.description:
The owner's actual shareholding percentage.
The Percentage is the result of direct & indirect ownership percentage and the percentage from a beneficial ownership.

BusinessPartnerName.title: businessPartnerName
BusinessPartnerName.description: A BUSINESS PARTNER may have several different NAMES, e.g. a legal name, different abbreviations, a name used in marketing / communication, etc.

formattedName.title: fullName
formattedName.description:
The Formatted Name contains the name parts which are used for written communication.
There may exist country specific rules to concatenate the name parts to this full name (MDG).

The formattedName or fullName is a calculated field containing the Organisation name or the concatenation of the first and last name. In the most Systems this field is read only because the properties are stored separately (e.g. firstName and lastName).

searchTerms.title: searchTerms
searchTerms.description: SEARCH TERM is a non mandatory, non governed grouping which can be syndicated across systems.
